Subjective: Muscle tension; Heart palpitations; Rapid breathing; Shortness of breath; Sleep disturbances; Fatigue; Symptoms worsened over past 2 weeks. No chest pain; No irregular heartbeat; No dizziness; No abdominal complaints. Works as doctor in internal medicine; High job demands; Lives with supportive housemates. Affects work and sleep; Causes guilt over extra shifts.
Objective: BP 120/60; HR 65; SpO2 98%; RR 14; Normal heart and lung exam.
Assessment: Stress-related symptoms, likely job-related. No signs of cardiac or respiratory issues. Ruled out anemia, thyroid, or organ dysfunction pending blood tests.
Plan: Blood tests: Hgb, Thyroid, LFT, KFT
Encourage relaxation techniques: Coffee breaks, calls with friends, walks/swims
Consult occupational health for schedule adjustments
Follow-up if symptoms worsen or concerns persist
